jL1BLJ1yqq6fgUq3gf8_OA.text: Came in at 3 and it was dead but to be expected. Had my spicy tuna roll which is the way I judge sushi places to see if I'd like to try anything else. Was a good tasting roll will update when I try some more menu options

ASq7MGM-ztAm8Yiw7wszMA.text: I love this place! I discovered this little gem while getting jimmy johns when I first moved to the area in July, and my boyfriend and I have frequented it ever since! The sushi is the best I've had in awhile - super fresh tasting! The hibachi entrees are reasonably priced for the amount of food you get with them - we always have leftovers. The service is ok - seems like they only have 1 waitress and they tend to be very slow and not very attentive. Overall, the staff is very nice though. Only thing I'd change is the lack of music in the restaurant - most of the time when we dine in we're the only one there, and without music or tv noise the place is almost awkwardly silent lol

LGTjj0K8pnAivVjqaSiQvQ.text: Air conditioner broken, no note on the door. Food was really good, but I had to sweat as I ate my food. Talked to server, cashier, and manager about what they would do to get me in the door again...a free sweet tea! If you are going make sure it's comfortable in there as they really hurt my thoughts of tin tin. Thanks manager for nothing, enjoy our money it won't happen again.

mxppKJl3Y4FntaKn8-uXdQ.text: It's not terrible. Sushi menu is definitely limited. Did not try the hibachi only the sushi which was just ok. Not bad and not good. Probably wouldn't go back voluntarily. Some of their food is out of the box frozen like the crab Rangoon instead of made to order. I asked the waitress and she told me it was frozen.  The ginger salad was terrible because the ginger sauce was bad. Salad lettuce was browning. If you have options, I say pass.

_8Qi364OwyqmOfhxNue9ig.text: Went for lunch on a Friday.  When we walked in we were the only customers. By the time we left there was only one other person dining.  I ordered the ramen bowl with tofu, my friend got raw fish and rice plate. I'd say the only thing nice about the food was the portion. The fish didn't look fresh, but i didn't try it.  My tofu was the soft kind not cooked enough - it basically fell apart whenever I tried to pick it up. The noodles were udon, not ramen. The veggies were cut haphazardly (appearances do matter).  Flavor was okay, but definitely not good. I won't go back.

NK6Ceb0MUyYHkr3FawcvlQ.text: Great Chinese food! Best choice for Chinese in Charlotte! I had standard fare, sesame chicken, and my girlfriend had shrimp tempura with iron noodle soup.we both loved our dishes and wonder why we haven't visited before.

u5wrTKo8jqgPuuIn3u1ubA.text: DO NOT GO HERE if you have limited time for a meal - I just walked out after sitting there for 15 minutes looking at the menu. The first time I visited, the food was good, but the wait was unusually long for the place not being crowded at all (maybe 5 people, including myself). I decided to ignore it and assume that every restaurant has a slow day, but this second time was unacceptable. If you work in the area, and have limited time for lunch, save yourself the time and don't bother.

FKxpwc7LwV8adwaTYpUVlg.text: Nice atmosphere. I expected this to be more of a takeout place, but it is definitely more of an eat-in experience. We ordered  a Hibachi chicken meal, and some sushi rolls (Alaska and Tuna) The hibachi came with a salad, soup and choice of several sides. The salads came out, and almost immediately the soup and our main courses were brought to the table. The timing could use some improvement. The sushi was very good and the texture was better than most local places. We will definitely be back!

rkV0lUINz8bTyLf6Q0driw.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this place. Small in size and large in quality. The sushi menu is impressive and they currently have 30% off all sushi! This was definitely one of the driving forces behind my visit. The staff is friendly and attentive. I look forward to returning with friends!

AcDmlmZXhRkYoJVV0bT_zA.text: We found this place a couple months ago, and now call ourselves regulars!  The food is awesome and the service is top notch !!!

MMubT0q7YgWoyZj0cFOTlQ.text: Tried hibachi.. Expensive dinner.. Food quantity and quality is ok. May be I would try 1's in a month

sRgOLJ4WWOdO1uuDhNzw6Q.text: I liked the food a little better than the Toyoma restaurant down the road. The pricing was kinda expensive when they first open but they're having a 30% off hibachi and teriyaki dinners right now so it's pretty straight. The sushi is not bad, I tried a couple rolls. The only problem I found with the sushi is it all tasted the same to me. There wasn't anything wow about it so I kept ordering other rolls. The crab Rangoon was pretty good. Would recommend for a lunch spot.

LPUhzsi6C6Jh8w-nNxkfhg.text: DO NOT go here for takeout on your lunch break! Unless you want to spend the entire time WAITING for food. Not a first time diner, but not exactly my "go to" lunch spot either, I stopped in for lunch on a Tuesday afternoon. The place was practically empty except for two or three tables. So I ordered Teriyaki shrimp noodles with mushrooms and zucchini lunch special. Easy enough right? NOT EXACTLY...Spent half my lunch break waiting 25 minutes!!  What's worse is it was like this each of the two or three times I've been in. Staff seemed so nonchalant and complacent with no sense of urgency. What's the deal!?! From what I can see you could use the business. There are comparable restaurants like Thai Taste, Chen Fu, etc 5 minutes away that manage EXTREMELY BUSY lunch crowds AND complete a carry out order in 10 minutes or less. Never again Tin Tin!! Get with the program!!

HUYix-Ej_Qosk2JOB8WYsQ.text: the food here is very good and quite reasonably priced. the servers are friendly and the sushi is great.

Fut0ih6ONzrFk3fedoShyA.text: A+ Presentation & freshest sushi I've had in Charlotte. More fish than rice in the rolls which justifies a slight increase in price...

phgrX9tJrZqCbVQV5szq0g.text: The good and service was great. They have a decent selection of sushi and the hibachi was great. The prices were pretty good for the quality of food highly recommended.

MFBSIDoAnVa5XlwzEOWtBg.text: So enjoyed the courteous service and pleasant atmosphere here. The food was delicious and  plenty of it! We definitely plan to return soon.

yWA7rp08Ve0xWzVtPb73xw.text: Having a new job only 1 mile from Tin-Tin I decided to try it and I am so glad I did. the food is excellent and presentation makes you feel as if you are dining  5 stars at lunch. The wait time for the sushi is a little long but worth it. The decor is beautiful and inviting. I love this place and I find it hard to stay away!

Mgj_OFp2Qbs4llIPgD4rkQ.text: Absolutely horrible service!!  Just awful!  They weren't that busy but it took 5 minutes just to be sat. Once sat we had to ask for drinks.  And we never did order dinner because after about 15 minutes and the manager telling us "I'll be right back to get your order" we left.  I'll never go back.

hiJB5cC3g3g_tmCw3R9TCA.text: The hibachi meals are really nice. The sushi is good too. The potions are nice. Overall it's a nice place in the university area.

z6Khpf95m8frSfp4yrkyTw.text: Ticket #159. I went to this restaurant to place a to go order and before leaving. I asked the server if everything I ordered was in the bag and he said yes. When I got home of course I had missing item. I called back to the store and spoke with the young gentleman explaining to him my item was missing. I asked to speak with management he placed Alyssa on the phone. Alyssa was the young girl who took my order. I asked her was she the manager she said no. Very unprofessional to put a server on the phone when I clearly asked for a manager. A very extremely rude man got on the phone. He refused to give me his name and before I could even explain the reason for the call. He said what do you want then hung up on me! I called back and a young female answered the phone and she said you just called. I said, yes I did and I told her the manager was very rude and he hung up the phone. I told her I spend so much money here and this is the way the company treat there loyal customers. I told her since he wants to be rude to me. I will have my husband come back up there to see how rude he will be then! These type of companies that don't care about being professional will suffer the consequences!

kRcMU_u-_a0G3MHMNl8dIg.text: Have been sitting here for almost 1 hour waiting for our food. Short staffed. Poor management. No one here cares about customer service. No wonder they offer discounts on their food.   Good waitresses  - work their butt off. We won't be visiting his place again. Much better options in the area.

_s6UT2gpB-EJq_LOrgJwWA.text: Tin tin has good food at great prices. It's rare to find a BOGO roll place in charlotte so we were very pleased to find this one. Service is a little slow but no problem.

hWgsznz_LTXbgEGutD1z9w.text: This is my second or third meal from Tin Tin. Today they are running an excellent special on the hibachi chicken for $2.95. It includes one veggie and two sides, a definite steal for the money! I would say overall, the service is moderate but the food is above satisfactory for takeout Japane

t9l9kywcw58L8fv9lDh0ow.text: I come to Tin Tin Cafe about 1-3 times a week for either their Hibachi, sushi or BOTH! I am so picky about my Hibachi and this place has NEVER disappointed! I don't like Toyamas, Ishi, Ichi, Kabuto's Hibachi especially compared to Tin Tin. It's AMAZING. their tin tin roll is one of my favorite sushi. I've recommended 7-15 friends here and they all LOVE it sooooooo much to where they even recommend their friends! They give you so much food. It's amazing.

oMKe3D63AwTO250CQRdTJg.text: We love this place for some go-to weekday sushi. It's not quite a high-end, trendsetting place. And quite often it's really quiet in there with only a few other customers, but they do a lot of takeout. Their sushi is fresh, with some really tasty rolls. Service is down to earth and helpful. Plus, the 20% off most dinner items seems to be a semi-permanent feature of the place! Yay!

hOPhsflgcReRDqbeoZxSKQ.text: I hope business picks up or this might go the way of its predecessors in this strip. We were the only table for Thursday lunch. Service was great food was really amazing. Especially for the price! Currently they are offering 30% off of all lunch items and sushi. We gorged ourselves on sushi rolls as well as hibachi lunch entrees.  All were good.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch hibachi vegetables
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch hibachi shrimp
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy tuna

QJw5nMb8aP6L93GCOwXu6g.text: Perfect day for lunch at Tin Tin - Buy 1, Get 1 Free Sushi Menu. I ordered the Florida Roll w/ salmon and the Mary Roll. Both were delicious, but the Florida Roll is my fav!  My experience walking in the door, I was not greeted nor acknowledged as a new customer until I stopped a waiter and asked if it was self seating. She only replied that it was a 15-20 min wait, but the restaurant was half empty (of course I was confused). I seated myself and waited 10 minutes before stopping another waiter and asking her to take my order. Customer service needs to be better, but the food was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Florida Roll w/ Salmon on left &amp; Mary Roll on the right

ikVYBaTZ_sHMCc_HilU6HA.text: Very good sushi and appetizers! We ordered from Tin Tin for the first time today and we were NOT disappointed! The two rolls we ordered (Creamy Roll and Crunch Shrimp Roll) were excellent, but the appetizers were phenomenal. Delicious crab rangoon and salt-and-pepper calamari made the meal exceptional.

nfbE66XZlEI3Jjf7mahpCQ.text: I  ate at this place before and the food was good! Customer service...was good. Today (02 May 17) the customer service was bad. My wife, my 2yr old, and I walked in at lunch. My wife asked a lady we assumed worked there, as she was walking by us, if we should sit ourselves. Now grant it, she walked up to three or four guys ordering at the bar/checking out....as she walked past us standing there. The lady's response was ,"just wait a minute." My wife asked again and the lady gave the same response. I asked my wife loud enough for everyone to hear if she wanted to eat her. She said no and we left. We went to Persis Biryani Indian Restaurant instead which was on the other side of the parking lot. When I got there I called Tin Tin and asked to speak to a manager. I was told they didn't have one. Persis staff was very polite. When we walked in they said ,"welcome." They were polite during our $34 lunch. Hey, I spent more because they were polite. Tin Tin, your food is good but work on your staff's courtesy. That lady could have said, I'll be with you in one moment ma'am instead of saying, just wait a minute. I guess this happens when people get comfortable.

20Z-pQhpM0fgnuUwzbNdpw.text: Sushi is great!  Hibachi is great and plenty.  Menu is extensive enough for me. Flavors of each meals are unique and consistent. Decor is pretty. Plating is artistic. Service is good. Take out is good, quick and accurate. Close to my home. I needed something like this near me. What's there not to like?

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi art
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetable Tempura. Delish!

CPAstHOZhfqTePh9FO0Eeg.text: The Bottom Line: Super fresh and bursting with flavor! I just love the noodle dishes.  I wish  that I had the capacity to do their menu justice as everything that we've tried has been spot on. The staff are friendly and I've found a new weekly staple.  Highly recommended.

zRtrcT5yXmhfDTg9uCTFWA.text: Sure the 3.99 chicken special sounds good except the portions are so small that I can eat the whole thing in 3 bites.Id rather pay more and get a bigger portion so I dont wind up still hungry after I eat it, and im a skinny guy.

k45EWW68SqJKfe0nmeyBMA.text: Best hibachi I have had in Charlotte and so affordable. We also had the crab roll and the tempura shrimp and both were very good. I love the fact that you get to choose the veggies you put in your hibachi

EJOKKvn02iUbc4gSTu7f8w.text: Finally tried this place last night because I wanted some sushi and didn't want to venture far from home.  There were very few other tables taken, but sounds like they do pretty good carry out business.  I ordered two rolls (spicy shrimp and crazy hot roll) and my husband was excited to see Cantonese Style Chow Fun on the menu.  The food came out so fast, I was sure it wouldn't be fresh or good.  Boy was I wrong.  The sushi and the noodle dish were both delicious!  We'll definitely be back.

UTJe4v1nrIEJv9KjtAzY1A.text: My absolute favorite sushi restaurant. The crunchy shrimp roll and sesame chicken are incredible!

v7duHs_zKQup8XDNC6COkg.text: This was a nice choice and we will go back. The service was excellent! I loved how clean the place was and I liked the decor, too. Our server recommended the Florida roll with salmon instead of tuna and it was delicious. I strongly recommend that. We had seafood noodle soup bowls as our main entrees. We thought the ramen and udon noodles were cooked perfectly. The only reason I can't give Tin Tin Cafe a 5/5 is that we had imitation crab in our soups. Give it a try! I hope to see you there.

SHNCAZGgrCXSPbzQLNYTEw.text: Friendly wait staff and a nice environment but I did have some issue with the food. Their sushi rolls and Shuman were good but I got the ikura nigiri and it was by far the worst I've ever had. It was honestly hard to eat. Really hindered my experience.

76YnHQtRCWRJHAZ5ifSRTA.text: The service that me and my friend received today was horrible. i ordered the passion roll and the boston roll, which was buy one get one free so i was very excited. after about 20 minutes, i received my food. the boston roll which was fried shrimp was just okay. the passion roll was supposed to be fried tuna but was CHICKEN. I am a pescatarian so obviously i needed to have my food sent back. So i proceeded to ask to speak with the manager and the waitress brought the manager over to my table. i told her that my food tasted like chicken and she says "it's obviously not chicken it's salmon and even if it was it was suppose to be tuna. i then asked her if she was in the back when they put my food together and she says "no, but i know what it's supposed to be and it's not chicken". at this point i was so over it and i want my money back so as she walks off she says "if you don't know how to order sushi then don't get it, that's common sense"  in no way was i rude to her for her to use that manner with me. By the way, her name was (ay-leen) i'm not exactly sure of the spelling but she was a manager. The prices was not worth the disrespect and the food was sub par.

reA4mWRRJZwVOJ02Oe78nQ.text: The food is good, service is below par.   My Chicken Udon Noodle Stir Fry came out about 20 minutes after everybody else got their food, so they were all already done eating. I asked for a to-go box right when I got the food, and was then lectured by our waitress about how I should eat at the restaurant and make my friends wait! Honestly, her attitude annoyed me more than the *very* late food.   Overall the food is fine, but I would prefer to go to one of the plethora of other Japanese places with the same quality of food and much better service.

9kRM66Nf1zv05eCgQztc2w.text: Dropped in for a lunch date for the second time.  Here are my thoughts....  The good... Great prices, courteous service, clean, good food....nice little restaurant.  The bad... Service is really slow, it took 10 minutes to get seated, once seated the service is still slow.  Sushi orders take nearly 30 mins.  We've heard several customers request their food be packaged "to go" because they've run out of time.  Summary.... nice spot, just make sure you're not pressed for time.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Atmosphere

xrFKrZm8wJ0oe9TsaGUsEw.text: Having me some good sushi. My bf and I really love this place. Reasonable price for a good amount of food

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

s93RyeYcYdBVes3pjD6COA.text: I arrived at 6:35pm eastern standard time we received our drinks it is now 7:34pm eastern standard time. We have not yet received our food. The manager "WILL" keeps avoiding our table. This is a very bad establishment to come to. The customer service is very bad and it's also very unpleasant and unprofessional.

qOfM5906sTuARPpYdug-bA.text: Loved this gem!   Great service, great ambiance, great price, and amazing sushi. Everything tasted so fresh! I've been needing a good, consistent sushi place in the area and I think I've found it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. 2 shrimp tempura, 1 chicken tempura, and a California roll

1m3tYHxwB7owZA63ZkSLSg.text: I very rarely give harsh negative reviews how ever this place needs to address their customer service skills.  I was not acknowledged when walked in they ignored me, no it was not busy at all maybe 2 tables were sat. After finally being seated (5 mins later) I waited another 10 mins before walking out due to no one coming to get my order.   I've seen good reviews on the food but can't tell you how it is. Will not be coming back.

RkxWITITxCztmaYfuVpb7w.text: Had lunch here the other day. Food was good, service fast and accommodating. We had tempura shrimp and vegetables, crab wontons, and sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

rrMQpsefm7BGVD6cfT8z2Q.text: I come here all of the time and have no idea why it is never packed. I lived in Japan for a long time and to me it's hard to find a good, quick service sushi/hibachi place. This place is seriously amazing. They have both great traditional rolls and fantastic creative and unique rolls. Service is quick and extremely courteous and the ambiance is gorgeous.  I hate writing reviews (unless they're bad ) but wanted to make sure to make people aware of this relatively new restaurant. It's tucked in with the Jimmy John's and Baskin Robins, so it's easy to miss. This is one of my favorite go-to places and definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. So pretty and relaxing!

jqtgP1jTCAAMiSoZp2Fgtw.text: We were hoping for a reliable place to have sushi/sashimi, but was sadly disappointed. We ordered the love boat for 2 and the fish was a bit frozen in the middle. We mentioned this to the waitress and she brought out the "chef" who explained to us (as if this was our first time having sushi/sashimi) that that is how the fish should be eaten and it would defrost in a few minutes. Really?

9E46qDQAX-bOsX80EmcaAA.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. The atmosphere is nice, clean and relaxing. The service is always great and quick. And the sushi is AMAZING. I can't believe how good the sushi is. We always have to get the crunchy rice roll because it's phenomenal. It's always consistently delicious. The prices are so low and it's always astounding how little we pay. This is the best sushi spot in charlotte. Everyone must give it a try!

KHfkGZAvk-bzPzPprstUEw.text: I have been to tin tin a few times. Each time I have dined in the service was extremely slow. And the latest time I went at 9:30 and they said the kitchen was closed and it was carry out only. Even though the website says 10 pm. Extremely rude to us. Will not return.

ZWP3o_zZC7w1Rd3Ecsq-mg.text: Really good fast service.  The tempura California roll proved to be the most popular choice for our party of 11 but I didn't care for it. The shrimp sauce is really good.  The server was very accommodating in supplying us with multiple checks. Room is nicely decorated and they have 2 televisions.  I would come here again for the lunch special. They did a very good job with my carrots.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hibachi with fried rice and noodles
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Double order of Tempura California roll
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crazy Hot Roll and Crunch Shrimp Roll

-60ob7ijWZVzuM__tLtWpA.text: I LOVE TIN TIN.  My absolute fav. Super fresh food made to order. The 3.95 special and buy one get one sushi is my go to. I've am allergic to shell fish and their tempura chicken sushi is everything. It's is define a must try, don't take my word for it. Get on over to Tin Tin for their amazing food. Oh and did I for get to mention the tempura cheese cake for dessert. Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

8JKZxaqwWDbOcbFAc7-u7g.text: Its just okay, best for lunch specials.  The service is slow and the sushi rice is too much for each roll

mDxHOCizSkMQ3PoaunuSAg.text: It was an average Sunday evening when the overwhelming desire for sushi came over me and a friend. My buddy suggested this place, having already been here a couple of times. To start, the place was absolutely empty at 8:30, so finding a seat was super easy. We were greeted and sat at one of the many booths in this place. Seriously, there's a lot of booths! Throughout the restaurant, you'll see a ton of colorful decor, making this place stand out from most sushi spots.   Once sat, the waitress took our order and that's when the excitement began! Despite a few hiccups in service from our server, the sushi rolls hit our table on a lovely white serving dish. After we cleared that dish, we added another couple of rolls to the mix. You know, just to confirm that the rolls were as good as we thought - for the accuracy of this review. No major complaints about the food, as all of the rolls we had were good to great!   One of the biggest negatives that I found with this place was their "30% off" offering... Why?! The food is plenty good to not tarnish the brand with silly discount signage in the front windows. The service could have been better, as we had to ask for some items on more than one instance. All in all, a good experience that I'd definitely return for.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Don&#39;t let the degrading discount signage scare you off!
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. NC roll in the front and FL roll in the back. Both are great choices!
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. The glow lighting that sets the mood for the bathroom. Very odd, yet different.

i7HsnjIpqE16ytgEkgSzBg.text: Great new restaurant in the University area. The sushi is very good, and the ramen is quite good as well. One of the best in Charlotte - and pretty much the only decent ramen in the University area.   I've been there a few times as well as ordered sushi takeout. The sushi has been good each time. I've only ordered the ramen once, but it was quite good. The noodles won't hold up to takeout though so if you're ordering it to go I'd suggest substituting with a sturdier noodle when you order.  The exterior of the restaurant itself is in an unassuming strip center, but the inside is very nice so don't be fooled. The service is friendly, though the sushi can take a little time when you order it, but always worth the wait. They have wifi available through TWC so if you are already a TWC user you can easily get online.  They really have an interesting menu, but I've found it hard to tear myself away from the sushi long enough to try many other items. So far my favorites are both the Spider Roll and Spider Man Roll as well as the Crazy Hot Roll. I can't wait to sample my way though other options. There are a variety of hibachi and noodle dishes as well as some Chinese and others.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rainbow Roll: Crab, avocado and cucumber topped with &#39;assorted fish&#39; - here with tuna, shrimp and yellowtail
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jack &amp; Cheryl Roll: Shrimp, avocado, cucumber topped with spicy kani, masago, meat floss, spicy mayo
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Assorted sushi: (top to bottom) Spider Man Roll, Spider Roll, Rainbow Roll

dqHgNCtz05KimD07HtQZcw.text: My girlfriend and I walked in there were only two other couples in the restaurant and all employees including one who I presume was a manager acknowledged us but did not greet us nor seat us until a few min later. The black server came off short and rude at first and then kind of changed her attitude. Probably won't go back to his sushi place especially when there are so many better throughout Charlotte

SVyozmB5114pFbk1tPnBNg.text: The food was good and the customer service was genuine. It's more expensive than Toyamas right up the road, but I wouldn't coming to splurge on their food. Also, if you go in the evening it's nicely lit with intimate lighting from the water art in the front, to the glass bottles that change at the top of the bar.

FtWf45ziqR_1OX9aM1zifw.text: Two of my friends and I tried this place shortly after opening for lunch. None of the lunch specials appealed to any of us. The lunch specials also seemed expensive, closer to $10 or more. In my mind if you are offering a lunch special it should be $6-$8 (I know $2 isn't going to make or break that many of us, but it's the principle!).   Two of us got a sushi roll and a side salad. My other friend got a larger sushi platter. The food was all right, but the rolls seemed to be on the smaller side. My friend who got the sushi platter was disappointed with the fish as well. Honestly when the bill came, it seemed really expensive for what we got. I feel like they were trying to be a fancy sushi restaurant but offering low-budget quality food   The restaurant opened in a space of the strip mall that has been vacant for YEARS. I was excited to see something go in there finally. They did a really good job with the decor and you can tell they thought about trying to create a cool atmosphere. However, my guess is that this place will not last that long if they don't try to capture more of a lunch crowd and offer some better deals.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crazy roll, spider man roll, and rising sun roll
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Rangoon appetizer

ARziHnqjM7UEwSc1YPNuJA.text: Definitely a strong 4.5 stars.  The entire staff at my job go to TinTin regularly on Thursdays.  I have been there now three times for lunch.  Their sushi is very fresh and they offer creative rolls.  Their jalapeno on their rolls is on FIRE so be warned.  Their lunch specials are super cheap.  I ordered hibachi chicken last time since it's cheaper than the veggies.  The chicken was good, but I regretted not getting veggies.  I'm just not that into chicken and I was just trying to save a few bucks.  I will be going back to my veggies this week for sure!  Their spring rolls are delicious and I burn my most every time because I just can't wait to eat it!  Service is usually good, but it took us forever to get checked out.  I will bring cash the next time as a result.  All in all, TinTin is great!  Be sure to peep their decor, especially the bathroom.  Interesting to say the least!

l_OCvBIGvg5MtCQAS_9UOg.text: Walked into a line in at the register blocking the entrance way. Stood there for about 6 minutes before reaching the front of the register just to let them know where waiting to be seated. Once we got seated it took around another 5 minutes to get a drink.   The waitress took our orders without writing them down, then continued to confirm our order as she brought out our drinks and appetizers. Would have been easier if she would have written it down.  Sushi was wonderful, and the volcano salad was probably my favorite. I ordered the stir fry shrimp udon noodle. Large portion for the whole family. All in all, great portions of food for good price.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nemo roll and jack and Cheryl or something like that
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon handroll
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Volcano salad

8rVpVY84qQMywJPCyDK4Vg.text: Awful! Awful! Awful!!!! The worst customer service ever. Manager cursing at the waitress, sushi chef, and other co-workers. Gave us attitude and didn't apologize to anyone. Mediocre food plus horrible service

pWDaiNdE705C2xj_W4MOTw.text: I was unimpressed with our service tonight. It took us 5-10 minutes before even asking what we'd like to drink. I understand if the server is busy but the host could have at least helped her out and gotten our drinks while she was in the weeds. Instead no one offered anything. By the time they came to our table we were ready to order but she needed more time to attend her other tables. She was hardly at our table and I needed to ask another server for help and he didn't seem like he wanted to help us much either. At this point I was just annoyed and ready to get our food. Finally, near the end was when we got any attention.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

00Grk0oBwJLbGG7f2duSSw.text: The food here is pretty good & cheap; however, this is the 3rd time I've showed up at 9:20-9:30 when google & their own door says they close at 10 & was turned away. Hostess said they only are open till 10 on weekends however, that is not what the door says or google.. unprofessional.

bVzmJ5fYPdWmpIXw0fyqYA.text: Buy one get one free on all sushi rolls everyday! Can't beat that deal.  Rolls are a decent size too!

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dragon roll on the left and Mary roll on the right

dK4CXz0ck8VUVqSCoYKRug.text: My best friend and I stumbled upon this place by accident and are so glad that we did. We wanted to find a good sushi place nearby and after reading the reviews we decided to give this place a chance. We came during lunch time and dined in. We both got sushi and hibachi (we were a little hungry that day). When you dine in, you can get buy one get one sushi & they also have hibachi specials for lunch and throughout the day on certain days of the week.  Prices are fair. Service was good. Since then I've gotten take out a few times and I haven't been disappointed yet!

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

1Yqm-nXG-M_gaqc9WqOBYA.text: If you like sushi at a good price then you definitely want to eat at Tin Tin Cafe off of Mallard Creek in Charlotte. The sushi is not only pleasing to the eye, but your pallet will also be satisfied. Bring a flashlight when you go because I think that they are trying to save money on the electric bill. The lighting is low and the restaurant is a bit dark. The lights are low to keep you from looking at your date if he or she is ugly. Anyway, the great food will make you come back. And, they have buy one get one free specials. Check out the pic.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

W8NbNDb8hag8ZetIRSgsRQ.text: Excellent portions and right now they have $6 Hibachi Shrimp. It comes with two sides.  The sushi is buy one get one free.  If you have a family it really is a nice place to sit down and eat dinner without having to pay an arm and a leg.  Kind of dark inside if you sit at a booth.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bamboo shrimp

C1mu-EI-JqopjGZQH09IKg.text: This is hands down my favorite sushi restaurant in Charlotte. They always have a buy one, get one roll free special and the rolls are huge. The rolls are also no more than $13 at most. So this is a place you can get a lot for not much of a cost. I have yet to have a bad roll from Tin Tin. My personal favorites are the Tin Tin roll, Tiger Roll, Tornado Roll, Shiki Crunchy Roll, NC roll, and Shrimp crunch roll. And because it is buy one get one, you can sample a lot of different rolls to find out which one you like best. Their appetizers are also tasty and worth a try. They also have $4 chicken hibachi and you can choose what you want in it. Overall this is a great quality restaurant that won't break the bank.

Z7En5ePGQ6TBLO9VFGuUcw.text: Get the hibachi special, best value for your $ and the food is tasty! Only $4.50 for a whole hibachi chicken meal. They also do BOGO on their sushi rolls, I highly recommend Tin Tin to anyone in the university area.

0KeeP0NbKe6xphI6kEfISw.text: The food is great but I would recommend doing take out! The service is decent but not up to par. I went with a friend one night here (of many nights I've tried dine in) and there was lipstick on my friend's water glass - and no, she was not wearing lipstick. Luckily we were given a new glass but something like that just leaves a bad taste in your mouth! I order take out a couple times a month, the prices are great and the food is good!

YZOys_a3ayRW4srl2YEHVA.text: My husband and I love this place! It is a hidden gem! The food is amazing, the staff is friendly, and the atmosphere is awesome! The prices are great too! We truly enjoy this spot!

TMlFCx9cH4RQ5kMbk0q4sA.text: Overall- I would give this place somewhere between 2.5 and 3 stars. Here is the run down:  We went on a Friday night. Decent crowd but no wait and not all tables were full. A friendly gentleman (I assume the owner or manager) seated us right away. He came back to the table a minute later and we ordered drinks and the crab rangoon. He came back five minutes later and took our sushi order. 20 more minutes passed and we wondered where the crab rangoons were. When the gentleman approached, he had our sushi. As he set it down, we let him know the crab rangoons never came. He told us he would check on it and that they only take "two minutes" to come out. Less than five minutes later, they were brought out. I'm pretty sure they weren't put in until we reminded him.   As for the food taste and quality- I'd definitely say skip the rangoons. We didn't even finish them because their was NO crab in it. None. Tons of cream cheese but no crab. We did, however, like the sushi. My fiance ordered the Smokey Salmon Roll and the NC Roll. I ordered the Sunrise Roll and Rising Sun Roll (I think that's what they are called). Next time I would skip the carrot that was in one of them but they were pretty good - especially considering the buy one, get one free deal.   Side note: the specials posted in the windows on project board paper doesn't look great. Makes it seem run down when the inside isn't that bad.   Overall, I would say it's a decent spot for sushi but not the best place around.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Rangoon (could not find any crab in it)
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunset Roll and Rising Roll
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. NC Roll (top) and Smoky Salmon Roll

hMOxgb_MlimGbhiWgFUD6g.text: My whole family is always happy with the food here. Top notch. However I don't give full five because we can't eat there anymore. Last time we were there, sat across from 4 people who spent their dinner time talking excessively loud; laughing and cursing. My kids didn't need to hear that and it wasn't a pleasant experience. I can't necessarily blame the place but I think they could have done something about it.

guC9A7EbWHEVl8C-M52ksg.text: Do they deserve 4 stars, no, but I still feel bad with 3.  3.5 seems right.  Its your nothing special cheap Japanse Habachi kind of spot.  A dime a dozen.  They weren't very busy, but its an interesting location and I was a little later than the average lunch time.  FYI, there is another similar spot .5 mile away.  But this place has much nicer decor.  They tried and the food wasn't bad.  It wasn't super awesome that the lady behind the register was talking on a cell phone and not really paying me attention when I tried to order, but hey, I was on hold on a cell phone as well.  I guess its just the way we live these days.  The Hibachi combo for less than $5 gets 4-5 stars for value.  That's the only reason I gave them a chance instead of Bojangles though.  Rice, a veggie and a spring roll.  A great deal.  The chicken was kind of pale and didnt' have a good sear to it, but still tasted fine and had decent texture.  It is what it is.  Would I go hear if looking for a nice meal.....  Probably not.  Would I give it another shot relying on value....  Will do.

Q5ZvTMhSWuu1iIN8TRLwUA.text: My favorite spot to get sushi! Service has always been solid and prices are definitely reasonable. The decor is also really neat and I love the smaller atmosphere of the place.

anPRxU0EvvpwJAB9380qmw.text: I went here all the time during college last year and I will say it's hard to beat the BOGO deal with what are mostly larger sushi rolls. BUT do not come here if you're in a hurry or already really hungry. It will take forever to get your food and there was only one waitress that was ever kind to me. The rest would ignore me or have an arrogant and rude demeanor. This would only add to the time for our order to be taken because they would walk past us even when we were the only customers there! I have had much better sushi but it will satisfy a sushi craving on a budget.

56tbRpJtSiclo6oR9wGd4g.text: My family and I have been ordering food from Tin Tin Cafe for several years.  Tonight was the WORST experience ever!! My daughter ordered calamari for takeout and when we got it the portion was not what you would expect for the price we paid.  My wife called to let Tin Tin know how disappointed we were in the order, which they remade for us, but when I picked up the second order the young and immature cook had the  audacity to come from the kitchen in SLIPPERS to confront me in front of my daughter about the amount of calamari that was cooked.  Very unprofessional and BAD REPRESENTATION of staff for this restaurant.  I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND Tin Tin Cafe to evaluate their staff/family before given them a position within the restaurant.  I would also recommend that Tin Tin Cafe to do there homework on BEST PRACTICES for how a restaurant treat customers as well.  Homework lesson #1:  Never let cookers come out to communicate with customers in bedroom slippers, White T-shirts and track pants. (customers can't take those individuals seriously)  Homework lesson #2: only allow managers and waiters to mitigate customer issues or someone who has the intellect of an adult.  Homework lesson #3: Be willing to take criticism when your quality of food isn't at the base standard for a restaurant.

4_NOebr9XZ5oLNyPvDvA3A.text: I stopped by with a few friends who invited me to go out to eat with them. I've never actually gone out exclusively for sushi before, so my opinion might not mean as much as somebody's whose has tried a lot of different sushi places. The restaurant itself is nice on the inside. It has a bunch of cool LED lights on the walls and the ceiling. I ordered the tempura California roll and the spicy tuna roll. The wait was a little long (30 minutes or so) considering we were one of two or three other tables seated at the restaurant, and the dishes came out one-by-one instead of all at once, but the sushi itself was good. The two rolls were buy one get the cheaper one free. It cost about $9 and change in total, and it was just enough food. I'll be back to try other kinds of sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cream cheese California roll (left) and spicy tuna roll (right).
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dragon roll (left) and tin to roll (right).
Photo of Tin Tin Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Masago nigiri
